name: BranchJoin
info:
The BranchJoin node can be used in each branch that you need to join. One overall Join node should be used in the end, linking all the outputs of the individual BranchJoin nodes.

The UI node needs to be configured with the following details:
 - Total count is the total number of branches expected to join.
 - Position in sequence should be from 1 to total count.

All branch outputs need to produce a relevant message for the final message to be complete and recompiled.

There are three options
1) Service mode: the selected flow will be deployed as a Node-RED service, thus always running
2) Node-RED Function mode: the selected flow will be wrapped around a Node-RED runtime and registered to a target Openwhisk platform, where it will be executed as a Node-RED runtime function
3) Native Sequence: the included functions will be packaged and registered individually at the Openwhisk platform, while their links (workflow) will be translated to the native Openwhisk sequence format and registered to the Openwhisk platform. This mode at the moment is limited to pure function nodes of Node-RED, while the workflow description is limited by the sequence abilities of Openwhisk. name: SEoutput_SimpleApp_HelloFunctionV2
JSON Schema Validation
info:
Validates JSON Schema on JSON instance.
Does not operate on payload.
It prints the complete output on console.
Expects as inputs and deleted from msg afterward:
- msg.instance: JSON instance to validate
- msg.schema: JSON Schema to use for validation
Output:
- msg.validationErrors: An ARRAY containing all validation errors. Empty if valid.
- msg.validJSON: A boolean. Set to true if JSON was valid.
